page.title: 07Farming on a Small Scale
page.content: Although many farms have been incorporated into large estates,there are still a number of small farms in the area. At{Home Farm}in the north_east Father and Son work the 120 acre farm which keeps livestock for commercial beef.They also make and sell sausages. On nearby {Hyde Farm }Mr.& Mrs. Simpson and their son farm 160 acres. They have a herd of 130 cross-bred Friesians and one dozen pedigree Sussex for beef.50 acres are used for growing wheat,barley and oats. {Springborne Stud Farm}at Brocks Green has 65 acres of grassland and about 15 acres of woodland.Beef cattle and horses are reared by the Reynolds family.On{North Ecchinswell Farm}Mr.& Mrs.Henderson employ a gardener and let their 160 acres on a grazing licence for beef cattle.
